revised_title: Further Observations on the Osteology of Iguanodon and Hylaeosaurus
tldr: The author examines additional fossil remains of Iguanodon and Hylaeosaurus, providing new insights into the structure and classification of these ancient reptiles. The study focuses on the cervical, dorsal, and caudal vertebrae, as well as the angular bone of the lower jaw, and offers a more accurate understanding of the skeletal structure of these creatures.
